wikipedia_page.main: Charles Gallogly (16 June 1919 – 12 January 1993) was an Irish professional footballer who played as a fullback for Huddersfield Town, Watford and Bournemouth.In 1950 he was awarded two caps for Northern Ireland.  In 1958, he emigrated to the United States – for whom he'd won a single international cap in 1949 – and managed Brooklyn Shamrocks F.C. from 1958–61. He died in New York on 12 January 1993.
